minister.translate: министр, священник, слуга, посланник, служить, прислуживать, помогать
examples: Russia's finance minister
The minister pronounced them man and wife.
The patient nurse ministered to the dying woman.
The minister said, “Let us pray.”
The minister evaded the question.
a meeting of EU foreign ministers
He always has access to the Prime Minister.
I have to minister to my mother all the time.
The minister delivered a long eulogy.
Have you ever heard that minister preach?
The minister spoke about death and damnation.
The minister was dismissed for taking bribes.
The minister was ordained only last month.
Church officials asked the minister to recant.
The minister was compromised in the bribery case.
The Minister fielded questions on the Middle East.

We have a new prime minister at the helm.

The prime minister is a man of the people.

The minister served the King for many years.

The minister doesn't see anybody before noon.
The new Prime Minister reshuffled his cabinet.
a crisis which will test the minister's mettle
I think the Prime Minister is only half right.
At the Restoration Hyde became chief minister.
a groundswell of support for the Prime Minister
example_translate: министр финансов России
Священник объявил их мужем и женой.
